value.title: Static Site Generator
value.subtitle: Primo gives you full control over your own hosting so you never have to worry about losing control of your site, even if primo stopped existing tomorrow.

value.html:
Frequently Asked Questions*

How is this free? And what do you mean by "free"?

Wanna know a industry secret? Thanks to the millions of AWS servers being spun up around the world, websites are really, really cheap to host and more capable than ever of handling millions of hits without breaking a sweat. And hosting platforms like Vercel and Netlify let you deploy dozens of websites to a global server network in minutes, for free. So why are proprietary site builders still so expensive? Sure, you can publish a website "for free", but only if you let them cover your website with a banner ad and prevent you from using your own domain name. That's like giving somebody the keys to a free house but when they get there it's just a yoga mat under a billboard.

The truth is that the margins on no-code websites are higher than the margins on movie theater popcorn. That's why everyone and their parent company has one (MailChimp, GoDaddy, Square). They're expensive because they can only be offered by one company; that means no competition or self-hosting. But since we released primo's source code under an AGPL license, anyone can offer it as a service to compete with us (though we don't know why they would), and anyone can use it from their own servers (which we recommend). So even if we wanted to we couldn't charge a lot for primo and expect users to stick around.

Free means publishing a fast, secure, easily-editable website for free. No banner ads, no primo-prefixed url, no tracking you across the web. And since primo's code-driven and you have full control over your hosting and website, we couldn't put a banner ad on it if we wanted to. So put up that website you've been wanting to make, all you'll have to pay for is the domain name.

What's a 'site builder'?

If this is a site builder, then where are all the color pickers and padding buttons and shadow sliders?

They're on every other site builder, but you won't find them on this one. That's because tools that abstract code away behind a picker, button, or slider make the website less flexible because those design options are locked down to only the color/function options that are connected to a visual control. And each and every one of those controls adds complexity to the tool's architecture - increasing its engineering costs and price. So whatever ease-of-use positives you get from them gets offset by the introduced rigidity. By getting direct access to the source in an intuitive coding environment, primo users are able to get access to the limitless flexibility and functionality of the modern web.

Do I have to be a professional web developer to use this?

No, in fact most of the people who use primo to build custom websites are freelance marketers. And many never switch over to the code and just use primo as a no-code tool because of the other benefits it offers.

How approachable is it, really?

The upside of this approach is easier content management, accessible custom development, and lowered costs across the board. Even users that never have never touched code before find it significantly easier to build websites with primo (without customizing the design), and are always surprised by how easy it is to tweak components.

Think it's too advanced for you?

Here's a state-of-the-art test see if you have what it takes to at least edit code.

Read these three cryptic computer symbols in order. See if you can decipher them.

text-black underline font-bold

If you guessed that they mean "black text, underlined, and bold", then congratulations, you're one of the chosen few who has what it takes to start using primo.

How is this more approachable than no-code alternatives?

Anyone can build and publish a website with primo in a few minutes thanks to the built-in themes. The code only comes into the picture when you want to edit your site's source code. And since primo's code-driven, your website's design can be kept in the code where it belongs. That means that the content management experience can be focused on, you know, content management. And editing components, writing copy, and building new pages can all be simple, focused, design-less jobs.

What's the catch?

No catch. But if you've never learned basic HTML/CSS, you'll have to spend at least a few hours and maybe a short intro course before you'll be comfortable building your own reusable components. But once you're past the shallow learning curve, you'll be able to build custom websites and learn skills that you can transfer into building web and mobile apps.

*theoretically

value.html:
why primo?

The Status Quo

There are plenty of options today for building websites, whether you can code or not. If you can’t code, site builders make it possible to build a website and edit content relatively easily, but at the cost of buying into a proprietary, expensive, closed system. If you can code, then you can typically build faster, more scalable sites by using static site generators, CMSs, and server-side frameworks. There are a few options which are approachable by non-technical and technical users, but the most popular one by far is WordPress.

WordPress has grown to be used by a third of the internet, not by pushing incessant YouTube ads, but by offering users a way to get started quickly and scale their site with custom development. But despite all its benefits, WordPress has gained a long list of shortcomings. It’s approachable, but not as non-technical-user-friendly as commercial site builders. It’s custom, but lacks a lot of the functionality developers have come to expect of the modern web and generally takes a prohibitive amount of skill and effort.

How primo’s different

primo is an integrated tool like WordPress, but by being component-driven and building on the best of the modern web it offers several advantages which make it significantly more approachable, productive, and scalable than WordPress for most sites.

Streamlined Custom Development

Until now, custom development has been out of the question for small publishers. Accessing a theme's code to customize it and add functionality is typically only something a seasoned developer could do (whether they'd want to is another matter), and building a site from scratch is no walk in the park. Since code is out of sight, it's out of mind, so pre-built themes tend to have a lot of flash, but lack the code quality that would be expected of a professional website (i.e. accessibility, semantic markup, light).

primo's themes and components are the first of their kind to be both fully integrated (i.e. usable out-of-the-box) and easily and completely editable. You can use them as a starting point to build entirely new components, or start from scratch utilizing the best tools of modern development (instant preview, TailwindCSS, JS modules) to build fully custom websites in a tenth of the time, right from your browser.

Simplified Content Management

primo's Content Management System is arguably simplest and easiest CMS in the world - combining the easy on-page editing of site builders with the content-focused approach of headless systems. That means that content editors only see options related to content - no design options or code, which means significantly easier onboarding and drastically fewer ways to break the site.

Content Blocks are fluid and get edited directly in-place, while components (which contain structured data) get edited in isolated forms next to a live preview of the component. Content editors can also build entirely new types of pages by using the site's Symbol Library combined with Content Blocks.

Integrated Component Libraries

Reusable components (called Symbols) are at the core of primo's advantage. By working from a library of components, content editors and developers alike can build an endless variety of new pages and websites. When you update a Symbol, it instantly gets updated every where it's used on the site. And when you build a Symbol in one site, you can instantly use it on any other site built in primo.

Fast, Secure, No Maintenance

When you hit 'publish', primo builds a static site out to a Github repository that you can host anywhere (often for free). Since your site is static and made of clean HTML/CSS, it loads in a flash and can't be compromised like an intricate CMS/server/database can. Plus it handles a ton more traffic and will stay alive for as long as you keep paying for the domain name.
primo is free to use, open source, and easy to get started with no matter your skill level. If you run into any issues you’re welcome to ask for help in our Discord server.
Get started

value.html:
Roadmap

Even though primo's already super useful, there's a lot of room to grow - here's what's coming up on the docket. If any of these excite you and you'd like to help out, feel free to grab a feature or join the Discord to see how you can help.

  • Load data from an API - Use primo with other CMSs/data sources

  • Server-side Rendering - Load external data before each page request

  • Desktop app - Build primo sites from your desktop (faster & offline)

  • Tailwind Intellisense - Create components using Tailwind Intellisense in the IDE

  • Svelte Component Type - Create Svelte components alongside HTML/CSS/JS components

  • Service Workers - Create service workers from within primo to enable multithreading and offline functionality

If you'd like to help bring any of these ideas to life (or you have another one in mind), join our Discord to see how you can help out.

value.html:
How it works

Primo.af is a hosted service - this makes it easier to get started and use.

It’s a web application which lets you build and manage your websites, but not host them. This is part of why we’re able to offer a generous free tier without bleeding money (it actually costs us close to nothing to offer the free tier).

When you create a website, primo automatically builds a repo under your Github account and stores your entire site inside of a single file called `primo.json`. It also builds your website out to the same repository. This is another reason primo can remain free, because it leverages Github as a backbone for storing your data, website, and even your images.

Once you’ve built your website out to your repository, it’s straightforward and also free to put it up on the internet for everyone to see.

value.html:
How they work:

  • Wordpress is server-side PHP application that needs to be installed on an Apache server, alongside a SQLite database, with NGINX and whatnot. If you want a second website, you have to do that all over again on another server. It is also offered as a service by its creator, Automattic, for x dollars a month per site. 

  • Primo is a client-side Svelte application that can be served on any static host, even a Dropbox folder. It uses a GitHub repository that both stores a JSON file as a database and where it keeps, tracks, and updates the static website files. A single primo server can host a theoretically unlimited number of websites. It is available as a service on primo.so for free, for an unlimited number of websites, with additional features available for a monthly price. 


What they do:

  • By default, a WordPress site has a theme applied, and you can get more themes for free at wordpress.org. WordPress lets you create posts as well as pages, write your content in the editor with some flexibility, and quickly publish or draft your changes to each site. There is a massive online market for additional themes or functionality, letting you turn your site into just about anything. You can also invite other people to edit the website. 

  • Primo offers a few free choices for themes, as well as paid themes. All themes in primo are modular and compatible, meaning that every website built or migrated to primo can have its pieces used across any other website on primo (with changes depending on their context). Primo sites are developed in a cloud IDE (meaning the browser), similar to sites like codesandbox and replit. It requires no setup and comes with TailwindCSS, ES Modules, and instant preview, among other useful development features to create components. Components are edited from forms in isolation, and copy content is edited on the frontend (with formatting available from the toolbar or using auto-converting Markdown). When changes to a primo site are saved, primo builds a save file (primo.json) to a connected Github repo. When the site changed are published, it builds a static site out to the same repo, from which it can be deployed to any given host. 


Which one’s better:

  • WordPress has been around for a long time, it’s had millions of users, thousands of contributors, and today serves a third of the websites on the internet. People and organizations of all sizes have depended on it for a long time, even the White House. With the recent Gutenberg editor, WordPress is user friendly enough to be considered a site builder. 

  • Primo’s foundation is built on the best of modern open source technologies. It doesn’t yet include nearly the subset of features of WordPress, but because it’s focused on smaller website instead of serving every need, it works very well for many use cases. Where WordPress has taken gone the way of site builders to cater directly to content editors, primo enables content editors by enabling developers. 


Who they’re good for:

  • Wordpress is good for large websites (50+ pages) with many data types and posts. It’s also good if you’re not a developer, or if you’re a WordPress developer with a good workflow for building from scratch, reusing components, and tracking your site with Git. It’s good if you have a lot of collaborators, and are frequently updating content. It’s good if you need a lot of pre-built functionality (as long as those plugins aren’t just something you could easily do with some code). 

  • Primo is good for smaller websites (less than 30 pages) with simply structured data. It’s good for one to a few collaborators. It has an ideal writing experience, and a simple, understandable interface for editing components. It’s good if you have more than one site, because you don’t have to think about them unless you want to. It’s good if you’re a developer (even a novice), because you can always unlock more functionality at a moment’s notice. It’s good if you like reusing components across sites.

value.html:
Switching from Firebase to Supabase

With the release of primo version 2.0, we’ve made the switch from Firebase to Supabase.

What we’re switching

  • auth

  • database

  • using storage soon 

  • Functions to Vercel 

Why we’re switching

  • auth issues

  • scalability issues of nosql 

  • pricing concerns 

  • proprietary concerns (getting locked in)

What’s been better about Supabase

  • Way faster authentication, no more timeout issues

  • Open source means when it didn’t have something I needed, I was able to add it in a couple days. 

  • Relational is so much better at any scale, and supabase makes it so easy there’s no reason not to use it. 

  • The dashboard is actually usable. 

  • Helpful and honest support

  • Rules engine is so much more functional

  • Automatic backups

  • Query for values

  • simpler codebase for fetching and storing data

  • better pricing 

  • Adding features 


What was better about Firebase

  • Cloud functions with CLI support, but once that lands I can’t imagine I’ll think about Firebase again unless I need machine learning or something


    Conclusion

value.html:
primo version 1.2

4/22/21

A lot has changed in the last few months for primo. It's significantly easier to use thanks to Blocks, easier to get started thanks to Themes, easier to write thanks to the new editor, and a lot more scalable now that primo's backend have moved to Supabase. Over twelve hundred people have signed up so far to try primo, and many of them have been using primo successfully to build all kinds of fast, secure, easily-editable websites, from landing pages to e-commerce sites.

Blocks

Blocks are full-width, well, blocks, which make up every page in primo. Blocks can be added easily by both developers and content editors and can contain on-page editable content, a component built from scratch, or a reusable component called a Symbol. Blocks replace the previous page section functionality, which was complicating primo’s architecture and going against its code-first approach. As before, a component built on one site can be used immediately on any other site (but may look different depending on the new context).

Themes

A theme is a collection of reusable components with additional styles for page content and page/site fields. You can still start from a blank canvas, but themes make it easier to get started quickly. That’s why WordPress themes and site builders like Wix and Squarespace are so popular: you can have a website in five minutes by starting with a pre-built site and filling it in with your own content.

But the issue with WordPress themes and site builders is that when you want to customize your starting point beyond a drop shadow here and a font change there, you can’t. At least, not easily, and certainly not for side projects. In primo, themes don’t face that issue because their code isn’t abstracted away behind a canopy of buttons and sliders. primo foregrounds the code so every pre-built component and theme in primo is limitlessly and easily editable (even by non-developers in many cases) and can be reused across different sites. Keep an eye out for community-contributed themes in the near future.

New Editor

In the previous version, the formatting buttons were hidden in the toolbar and disconnected from the content they were editing. By integrating the TipTap’s newest editor (created by the amazing Uberdosis), primo has access to a whole slew of functionality would have otherwise taken us forever to replicate. For now, the biggest changes are in-block element options (heading, list, etc.), a floating menu with formatting options (bold, italic, highlight), and the option to insert an image by its URL. TipTap’s team is working full-time on improving the editor and the editor is already in use by Gitlab, Statmatic, and others, so as time goes on we can expect more functionality like tables, tasks, and collaborative editing. 

Migrating to Supabase

Supabase is a new, open-source Firebase alternative that’s actually been better in every way for the features it currently matches (it's launching cloud functions soon). Migrating our authentication and database to it fixed an authentication issue a lot of users were experiencing, enables more authentication features, and in general makes primo more scalable thanks to the relational database and open source. Besides good feels, this actually lets us contribute new features as we need them, like we did when we started migrating.

And More

  • Email & passwordless sign in

  • New, dark UI

  • Lightning-fast authentication & no more timeout issues

  • Edit your sites from yourdomain.com/primo

  • Easier invitation system

value.html:
Why primo?

All-in-One

primo puts every part of your website within arm’s reach, making is easier to get started and simpler to deploy code and content updates. Whether you’re building from scratch or starting with pre-built components, you can immediately start editing code in the built-in IDE. And when you build a component, you can immediately start using it across all your sites. Besides a bunch of other benefits, this approach also enables the second half of primo’s strategy for productivity.

Component-driven

According to componentdriven.org, “Components are standardized, interchangeable building blocks of UIs. They encapsulate the appearance and function of UI pieces. Think LEGO bricks. LEGOs can be used to build everything from castles to spaceships; components can be taken apart and used to create new features”. primo makes this possible by integrating every part of a website - from the structure to the content - into modular components called Blocks. Websites in primo usually get edited one block at a time, but they can also be modified at the page and site level. So no matter what you want to edit or update on your site, whether you want to edit its code or its content, every change can be deployed in moments by navigating to a component and clicking ‘edit’. And maybe the biggest benefit is that, because every primo site is modular, every Block in primo can [usually] be seamlessly copied between all your sites.

Developer-friendly

Developers often have to choose between getting started quickly (but being locked) in and getting started slowly but being able to grow and scale. With primo, you don’t have to make that decision. You can both get started quickly by using the growing list of pre-built themes and components, and also have direct access to their code to modify them and build new components from scratch.

Code changes are always one toggle switch away. There’s no need to clone or bundle, your environment is always ready to go with instant previews, TailwindCSS, and JS modules. All you need to get started is a mobile or desktop browser.
Get started

value.html:
Privacy Policy

Most people don't read Privacy Policies. Yet here you are. You're probably interested in seeing what data we collect from you, what we do with it, who we sell it to. There's an expected amount of data every company collects and analyzes to improve their digital products, but a lot of products go far, far beyond that. Data is the oil of the information age after all, and we know how the oil thing went.

At the end of the day, regardless of the laws and contracts that are put in place to ensure you aren't being abused by the companies you buy from, nothing can replace trust. And the truth is, you can't trust us. Not yet anyway. Yes, we're open source, our privacy policy is short and we don't have any third-party trackers or ads. But we know that earning and keeping your trust is only something we're going to be able to do over time during every interaction you have with us and the things we build.

So read this legal document as a description of the data we collect and what we do with it - which is always in the service of making primo easier to use and more capable.

If there's anything in (or not in) our privacy policy that concerns you, please let us know.

If we don't respond in a few days or you're not happy with our response, please call us out on twitter.

Effective date: 04/11/2021

  1. Introduction
    Welcome to Primo Creative LLC

PRIVACY POLICY

Primo Creative LLC (“us”, “we”, or “our”) operates https://primo.so (hereinafter referred to as “Service”).

Our Privacy Policy governs your visit to https://primo.so, and explains how we collect, safeguard and disclose information that results from your use of our Service.

We use your data to provide and improve Service. By using Service, you agree to the collection and use of information in accordance with this policy. Unless otherwise defined in this Privacy Policy, the terms used in this Privacy Policy have the same meanings as in our Terms and Conditions.

Our Terms and Conditions (“Terms”) govern all use of our Service and together with the Privacy Policy constitutes your agreement with us (“agreement”).

  1. Definitions

    SERVICE means the https://primo.so website operated by Primo Creative LLC

    PERSONAL DATA means data about a living individual who can be identified from those data (or from those and other information either in our possession or likely to come into our possession).

    USAGE DATA is data collected automatically either generated by the use of Service or from Service infrastructure itself (for example, the duration of a page visit).

    COOKIES are small files stored on your device (computer or mobile device).

    DATA CONTROLLER means a natural or legal person who (either alone or jointly or in common with other persons) determines the purposes for which and the manner in which any personal data are, or are to be, processed. For the purpose of this Privacy Policy, we are a Data Controller of your data.

    DATA PROCESSORS (OR SERVICE PROVIDERS) means any natural or legal person who processes the data on behalf of the Data Controller. We may use the services of various Service Providers in order to process your data more effectively.

    DATA SUBJECT is any living individual who is the subject of Personal Data.
    THE USER is the individual using our Service. The User corresponds to the Data Subject,

    who is the subject of Personal Data.

  2. Information Collection and Use

    We collect several different types of information for various purposes to provide and improve our Service to you.

  3. Types of Data Collected

Personal Data

While using our Service, we may ask you to provide us with certain personally identifiable information that can be used to contact or identify you (“Personal Data”). Personally identifiable information may include, but is not limited to:

(a) Email address

(b) Cookies and Usage Data

We may use your Personal Data to contact you with newsletters, marketing or promotional materials and other information that may be of interest to you. You may opt out of receiving any, or all, of these communications from us by following the unsubscribe link.

Usage Data

We may also collect information that your browser sends whenever you visit our Service or when you access Service by or through a mobile device (“Usage Data”).

This Usage Data may include information such as your computer's Internet Protocol address (e.g. IP address), browser type, browser version, the pages of our Service that you visit, the time and date of your visit, the time spent on those pages, unique device identifiers and other diagnostic data.

When you access Service with a mobile device, this Usage Data may include information such as the type of mobile device you use, your mobile device unique ID, the IP address of your mobile device, your mobile operating system, the type of mobile Internet browser you use, unique device identifiers and other diagnostic data.

Tracking Cookies Data

We use cookies and similar tracking technologies to track the activity on our Service and we hold certain information.

Cookies are files with a small amount of data which may include an anonymous unique identifier. Cookies are sent to your browser from a website and stored on your device. Other tracking technologies are also used such as beacons, tags and scripts to collect and track information and to improve and analyze our Service.

You can instruct your browser to refuse all cookies or to indicate when a cookie is being sent. However, if you do not accept cookies, you may not be able to use some portions of our Service.

Examples of Cookies we use:

  1. (a)  Session Cookies: We use Session Cookies to operate our Service.

  2. (b)  Preference Cookies: We use Preference Cookies to remember your preferences and various settings.

  3. (c)  Security Cookies: We use Security Cookies for security purposes.

  4. (d)  Advertising Cookies: Advertising Cookies are used to serve you with advertisements that may be relevant to you and your interests.

Other Data

While using our Service, we may also collect the following information: sex, age, date of birth, place of birth, passport details, citizenship, registration at place of residence and actual address, telephone number (work, mobile), details of documents on education, qualification, professional training, employment agreements, non-disclosure agreements, information on bonuses and compensation, information on marital status, family members, social security (or other taxpayer identification) number, office location and other data.

  1. Use of Data

    Primo Creative LLC uses the collected data for various purposes:

    1. (a)  to provide and maintain our Service;

    2. (b)  to notify you about changes to our Service;

    3. (c)  to allow you to participate in interactive features of our Service when you choose to do so;

    4. (d)  to provide customer support;

    5. (e)  to gather analysis or valuable information so that we can improve our Service;

    6. (f)  tomonitortheusageofourService;

    7. (g)  to detect, prevent and address technical issues;

    8. (h)  to fulfill any other purpose for which you provide it;

    9. (i)  to carry out our obligations and enforce our rights arising from any contracts entered into between you and us, including for billing and collection;

    10. (j)  to provide you with notices about your account and/or subscription, including expiration and renewal notices, email-instructions, etc.;

    11. (k)  to provide you with news, special offers and general information about other goods, services and events which we offer that are similar to those that you have already purchased or enquired about unless you have opted not to receive such information;

    12. (l)  in any other way we may describe when you provide the information;

    (m)for any other purpose with your consent.

  2. Retention of Data

    We will retain your Personal Data only for as long as is necessary for the purposes set out in this Privacy Policy. We will retain and use your Personal Data to the extent necessary to comply with our legal obligations (for example, if we are required to retain your data to comply with applicable laws), resolve disputes, and enforce our legal agreements and policies.

    We will also retain Usage Data for internal analysis purposes. Usage Data is generally retained for a shorter period, except when this data is used to strengthen the security or to

improve the functionality of our Service, or we are legally obligated to retain this data for longer time periods.

  1. Transfer of Data

    Your information, including Personal Data, may be transferred to – and maintained on – computers located outside of your state, province, country or other governmental jurisdiction where the data protection laws may differ from those of your jurisdiction.

    If you are located outside United States and choose to provide information to us, please note that we transfer the data, including Personal Data, to United States and process it there.

    Your consent to this Privacy Policy followed by your submission of such information represents your agreement to that transfer.

    Primo Creative LLC will take all the steps reasonably necessary to ensure that your data is treated securely and in accordance with this Privacy Policy and no transfer of your Personal Data will take place to an organisation or a country unless there are adequate controls in place including the security of your data and other personal information.

  2. Disclosure of Data

    We may disclose personal information that we collect, or you provide:

    (a) Disclosure for Law Enforcement.
    Under certain circumstances, we may be required to disclose your Personal Data if required to do so by law or in response to valid requests by public authorities.

    (b) Other cases. We may disclose your information also:

    1. (i)  to our subsidiaries and affiliates;

    2. (ii)  to fulfill the purpose for which you provide it;

    3. (iii)  for the purpose of including your company’s logo on our website;

    4. (iv)  for any other purpose disclosed by us when you provide the information;

    5. (v)  with your consent in any other cases;

    6. (vi)  if we believe disclosure is necessary or appropriate to protect the rights, property, or safety of the Company, our customers, or others.

  3. Security of Data

    The security of your data is important to us but remember that no method of transmission over the Internet or method of electronic storage is 100% secure. While we strive to use commercially acceptable means to protect your Personal Data, we cannot guarantee its absolute security.

  4. Your Data Protection Rights Under General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)

If you are a resident of the European Union (EU) and European Economic Area (EEA), you have certain data protection rights, covered by GDPR. – See more at https://eur- lex.europa.eu/eli/reg/2016/679/oj

We aim to take reasonable steps to allow you to correct, amend, delete, or limit the use of your Personal Data.

If you wish to be informed what Personal Data we hold about you and if you want it to be removed from our systems, please email us at support@primo.af.

In certain circumstances, you have the following data protection rights:

  1. (a)  the right to access, update or to delete the information we have on you;

  2. (b)  the right of rectification. You have the right to have your information rectified if that information is inaccurate or incomplete;

  3. (c)  the right to object. You have the right to object to our processing of your Personal Data;

  4. (d)  the right of restriction. You have the right to request that we restrict the processing of your personal information;

  5. (e)  the right to data portability. You have the right to be provided with a copy of your Personal Data in a structured, machine-readable and commonly used format;

  6. (f)  the right to withdraw consent. You also have the right to withdraw your consent at any time where we rely on your consent to process your personal information;

Please note that we may ask you to verify your identity before responding to such requests. Please note, we may not able to provide Service without some necessary data.

You have the right to complain to a Data Protection Authority about our collection and use of your Personal Data. For more information, please contact your local data protection authority in the European Economic Area (EEA).

Your Data Protection Rights under the California Privacy Protection Act (CalOPPA)

CalOPPA is the first state law in the nation to require commercial websites and online services to post a privacy policy. The law’s reach stretches well beyond California to require a person or company in the United States (and conceivable the world) that operates websites collecting personally identifiable information from California consumers to post a conspicuous privacy policy on its website stating exactly the information being collected and those individuals with whom it is being shared, and to comply with this policy. – See more at: https://consumercal.org/about-cfc/cfc-education-foundation/california-online-privacy- protection-act-caloppa-3/

According to CalOPPA we agree to the following:

  1. (a)  users can visit our site anonymously;

  2. (b)  our Privacy Policy link includes the word “Privacy”, and can easily be found on the page specified above on the home page of our website;

(c) users will be notified of any privacy policy changes on our Privacy Policy Page;
(d) users are able to change their personal information by emailing us at support@primo.af. Our Policy on “Do Not Track” Signals:

We honor Do Not Track signals and do not track, plant cookies, or use advertising when a Do Not Track browser mechanism is in place. Do Not Track is a preference you can set in your web browser to inform websites that you do not want to be tracked.

You can enable or disable Do Not Track by visiting the Preferences or Settings page of your web browser.

12. Service Providers

We may employ third party companies and individuals to facilitate our Service (“Service Providers”), provide Service on our behalf, perform Service-related services or assist us in analysing how our Service is used.

These third parties have access to your Personal Data only to perform these tasks on our behalf and are obligated not to disclose or use it for any other purpose.

13. Analytics

We may use third-party Service Providers to monitor and analyze the use of our Service.

Plausible Analytics

Plausible is an open-source web traffic analysis tool

For more information on what type of information Ackee collects, please visit their Terms of Service page: https://plausible.io/privacy

14. CI/CD tools

We may use third-party Service Providers to automate the development process of our Service.

GitHub

GitHub is provided by GitHub, Inc.

GitHub is a development platform to host and review code, manage projects, and build software.

For more information on what data GitHub collects for what purpose and how the protection of the data is ensured, please visit GitHub Privacy Policy page: https://help.github.com/en/ articles/github-privacy-statement.

15. Payments

We may provide paid products and/or services within Service. In that case, we use third- party services for payment processing (e.g. payment processors).

We will not store or collect your payment card details. That information is provided directly to our third-party payment processors whose use of your personal information is governed by their Privacy Policy. These payment processors adhere to the standards set by PCI-DSS as managed by the PCI Security Standards Council, which is a joint effort of brands like Visa, Mastercard, American Express and Discover. PCI-DSS requirements help ensure the secure handling of payment information.

The payment processors we work with are:

Stripe:

Their Privacy Policy can be viewed at: https://stripe.com/us/privacy

16. Links to Other Sites

Our Service may contain links to other sites that are not operated by us. If you click a third party link, you will be directed to that third party's site. We strongly advise you to review the Privacy Policy of every site you visit.

We have no control over and assume no responsibility for the content, privacy policies or practices of any third party sites or services.

17. Children's Privacy

Our Services are not intended for use by children under the age of 13 (“Children”).

We do not knowingly collect personally identifiable information from Children under 13. If you become aware that a Child has provided us with Personal Data, please contact us. If we become aware that we have collected Personal Data from Children without verification of parental consent, we take steps to remove that information from our servers.

18. Changes to This Privacy Policy

We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page.

We will let you know via email and/or a prominent notice on our Service, prior to the change becoming effective and update “effective date” at the top of this Privacy Policy.

You are advised to review this Privacy Policy periodically for any changes. Changes to this Privacy Policy are effective when they are posted on this page.

19. Contact Us

If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us: By email: support@primo.af.

If you do not agree with (or cannot comply with) Agreements, then you may not use the Service, but please let us know by emailing at support@primo.af so we can try to find a solution. These Terms apply to all visitors, users and others who wish to access or use Service.

A valid payment method, including credit card or PayPal, is required to process the payment for your subscription.
